info.title: IA-Connect Java
info.description: IA-Connect is a Robotic Process Automation (RPA) platform which adds RPA functionality from the Cloud to on-premises virtual machines or over Citrix or Microsoft Remote Desktop (RDS) connections. This is the module for automating Java applications using the Java Access Bridge (JAB).

post.description: Starts the IA-Connect Java subsystem (IA-JavaAccessBridge) and connects it to the specified Java Access Bridge DLL (or leave blank to search for one). This step must be performed before you can automate Java applications. This action also enables the Java Access Bridge which must be enabled before running any Java applications.

WindowsAccessBridgeDLLSearchFolder.title: Windows Access Bridge DLL search folder
WindowsAccessBridgeDLLSearchFolder.description: Either specify the folder containing the Windows Access Bridge DLL (a component of the Java runtime) in the session where the Agent is running or enter the full filename of a Windows Access Bridge DLL to force that particular DLL to be used. If you do not provide a path, then the standard Windows search path will be used.

IAJavaAccessBridgePath.title: IA-JavaAccessBridge DLL path
IAJavaAccessBridgePath.description: The location of the IA-JavaAccessBridge.dll COM DLL (a built-in component of the IA-Connect Agent) if you need to host it externally to the EXE (perhaps due to a security allow list). This can either be the full path, or the path relative to the location of the IA-Connect Agent. For example, if both the Agent and the IA-JavaAccessBridge.dll COM DLL are in the same folder then just passing the file name of the DLL is sufficient.

Is64BitJABDLL.title: Is 64bit Windows Access Bridge DLL
Is64BitJABDLL.description: Is the Windows Access Bridge DLL being used 64bit?

UseCOMFor64BitJABDLL.title: Use COM for 64bit IA-JavaAccessBridge DLL
UseCOMFor64BitJABDLL.description: If the Windows Access Bridge DLL you are trying to load is 64bit, should this be run via an out-of-process COM DLLSurrogate instead of calling directly (in memory) from IA-Connect. By default, this is set to 'True'. You could try unchecking this if the IA-JavaAccessBridge DLL is being blocked.

EnableJavaAccessBridge.title: Enable Java Access Bridge
EnableJavaAccessBridge.description: Should the Java Access Bridge be enabled? By default, this is set to 'True'.

AccessibilityFilepath.title: Accessibility file path
AccessibilityFilepath.description: The path to the .accessibility.properties file which controls whether the Java Access Bridge is enabled. If you do not provide a path, then this defaults to %USERPROFILE%\.accessibility.properties.

CommandTimeoutInSeconds.title: Command timeout in seconds
CommandTimeoutInSeconds.description: The maximum number of seconds to wait for IA-Connect to connect to the Java Access Bridge. By default, this is 20 seconds.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

LoadedWindowsAccessBridgeDLL.title: Loaded Windows Access Bridge DLL
LoadedWindowsAccessBridgeDLL.description: The full filename of the Windows Access Bridge DLL that was loaded.

post.description: Shuts down any running IA-Connect Java subsystem (IA-JavaAccessBridge).

DisableJavaAccessBridge.title: Disable Java Access Bridge
DisableJavaAccessBridge.description: Should the Java Access Bridge be disabled? By default, this is set to 'True'.

AccessibilityFilepath.title: Accessibility file path
AccessibilityFilepath.description: The path to the .accessibility.properties file which controls whether the Java Access Bridge is enabled. If you do not provide a path, then this defaults to %USERPROFILE%\.accessibility.properties.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.summary: Get windows access bridge connection status
post.description: Returns the current status of the connection between IA-Connect Agent and the Windows Access Bridge (WAB). If IA-Connect Agent is connected to the WAB then the relevant details are returned as outputs.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

Connected.title: WAB connected
Connected.description: Returns true if the IA-Connect Agent is connected to the Windows Access Bridge or false if not.

ConnectionType.title: WAB connection type
ConnectionType.description: The type of connection to the Windows Access Bridge, for example COM or Native and 32bit or 64bit.

IsWAB64bit.title: Is WAB 64bit
IsWAB64bit.description: Returns true if the Windows Access Bridge is 64 bit or false if not.

ConnectionError.title: Connection error
ConnectionError.description: The connection error, if one has been reported.

LoadedIAJABDLL.title: Loaded IA-JavaAccessBridge COM DLL
LoadedIAJABDLL.description: The full path to the loaded IA-JavaAccessBridge COM DLL.

LoadedWABDLL.title: Loaded Windows Access Bridge DLL
LoadedWABDLL.description: The full path to the loaded Windows Access Bridge DLL.

WABVersion.title: Windows Access Bridge DLL version
WABVersion.description: The version of the loaded Windows Access Bridge DLL.

post.description: Returns whether a UIA window is a Java element.

ParentWindowHandle.title: Parent window handle
ParentWindowHandle.description: The parent UIA window handle to act as the starting point for the search. This can be discovered via Inspection using UIA actions such as 'Wait for desktop element' or 'Wait for element'.

SearchElementName.title: Search element name
SearchElementName.description: The optional UIA element name to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchElementClassName.title: Search element class name
SearchElementClassName.description: The optional UIA element class name to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchElementAutomationId.title: Search element automation ID
SearchElementAutomationId.description: The optional UIA element automation ID to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchLocalizedControlType.title: Search element localized control type
SearchLocalizedControlType.description: The optional UIA element localized control type to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchSubTree.title: Search UIA subtree
SearchSubTree.description: If set to true then the whole tree below the parent window handle will be searched. This is more thorough but can take longer. If set to false, only elements directly below the parent window handle in the tree will be searched.

MatchIndex.title: Match index
MatchIndex.description: If multiple elements match the search, which element (starting at 1) should be matched. Can be used in conjunction with 'Sort by column' to choose the sort order for matching.

SearchFilter.title: Search filter
SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators and any element field. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Name] like 'Document*' AND [Role] like 'Label*'. See the documentation for more examples.

SortByColumn.title: Sort by column name
SortByColumn.description: If multiple elements match the search, this allows you to specify which element property to sort by. This will be used in conjunction with 'Match index' to pick the required element. For example: If 'Sort by column name' is [TopEdge] and 'Match index' is 1 then the matching element nearest the top of the screen will be matched.

MatchIndexAscending.title: Match index is ascending
MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple elements match the search, should 'Match index' match from the top of the sorted list (true) or from the bottom of the sorted list (false).

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

IsJavaWindow.title: Is Java window
IsJavaWindow.description: Returns true if the UIA element found is a Java window or false if not.

post.description: Returns information about the Windows Access Bridge (WAB) for a particular Java VM ID, including the Java and Windows DLL versions. The Java VM ID can be obtained as an output from the 'Get Java element properties' action.

VMID.title: VM ID
VMID.description: The Java Virtual Machine ID. This is unique across all Java virtual machines.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

JavaClassVersion.title: Java class version
JavaClassVersion.description: The Java class version, for example '1.8.0_261'.

JavaDLLVersion.title: Java DLL version
JavaDLLVersion.description: The Java DLL version, for example '1.8.0_261'.

WinDLLVersion.title: Windows DLL version
WinDLLVersion.description: The Windows DLL version, for example '1.8.0_261'.

VMVersion.title: VM version
VMVersion.description: The Java VM version, for example '1.8.0_261'.

post.summary: Get Java properties for UIA element

Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

ElementJABHandle.title: Element JAB handle
ElementJABHandle.description: If the search element was found, this will hold a numeric element handle which can be used in further actions to act as a 'parent' handle for further searches (i.e. to locate elements relative to this handle).

ElementVMID.title: Element VMID
ElementVMID.description: The ID of the Java virtual machine running the Java program.

ElementName.title: Element name
ElementName.description: The Java name of the located element.

ElementDescription.title: Element description
ElementDescription.description: The Java description of the located element (if there is one).

ElementRole.title: Element role
ElementRole.description: The Java role (e.g. frame or panel) of the located element (if there is one).

ElementStates.title: Element states
ElementStates.description: The Java element's supported states (e.g. focusable, visible) in the locale of the Agent session.

ElementStates_en_US.title: Element states en_US
ElementStates_en_US.description: The Java element's supported states (e.g. focusable, visible) in the en_US locale.

ElementLeftEdge.title: Element left edge
ElementLeftEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the left edge of the Java element or window and the left edge of the display.

ElementTopEdge.title: Element top edge
ElementTopEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the top edge of the Java element or window and the top edge of the display.

ElementWidth.title: Element width
ElementWidth.description: The width of the Java element in pixels.

ElementHeight.title: Element height
ElementHeight.description: The height of the Java element in pixels.

ElementRightEdge.title: Element right edge
ElementRightEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the right edge of the Java element or window and the left edge of the display.

ElementBottomEdge.title: Element bottom edge
ElementBottomEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the bottom edge of the Java element or window and the top edge of the display.

IsComponentElement.title: Is component element
IsComponentElement.description: Returns true if the Java element is a container or false if not.

IsActionElement.title: Is action element
IsActionElement.description: Returns true if the Java element is an action element or false if not.

IsSelectionElement.title: Is selection element
IsSelectionElement.description: Returns true if the Java element is a selection or false if not.

IsTextElement.title: Is text element
IsTextElement.description: Returns true if the Java element is a text element or false if not.

IsEnabled.title: Is enabled
IsEnabled.description: Returns true if the Java element is enabled or false if not. A disabled element is typically visible but cannot be interacted with.

IsVisible.title: Is visible
IsVisible.description: Returns true if the Java element is visible or false if not.

IsShowing.title: Is showing
IsShowing.description: Returns true if the Java element is showing or false if not.

IsOpaque.title: Is opaque
IsOpaque.description: Returns true if the Java element is opaque or false if not.

IsFocusable.title: Is focusable
IsFocusable.description: Returns true if the Java element be focussed by the keyboard or false if not. This may be of limited use since most elements are keyboard focusable.

IsEditable.title: Is editable
IsEditable.description: Returns true if the Java element is editable or false if not.

IsSingleLine.title: Is single line
IsSingleLine.description: Returns true if the Java element is a single line or false if not.

IsResizable.title: Is resizable
IsResizable.description: Returns true if the Java element is resizable or false if not.

IsModal.title: Is modal
IsModal.description: Returns true if the Java element is modal or false if not. A modal element will block the main application window, preventing you from interacting with it.

IsCollapsed.title: Is collapsed
IsCollapsed.description: Returns true if the Java element is collapsed or false if not.

IsSelectable.title: Is selectable
IsSelectable.description: Returns true if the Java element is selectable or false if not.

IsSelected.title: Is selected
IsSelected.description: Returns true if the Java element is selected or false if not.

IsVertical.title: Is vertical
IsVertical.description: Returns true if the Java element is vertical or false if not.

IsHorizontal.title: Is horizontal
IsHorizontal.description: Returns true if the Java element is horizontal or false if not.

IsActive.title: Is active
IsActive.description: Returns true if the Java element is active or false if not.

IsChecked.title: Is checked
IsChecked.description: Returns true if the Java element is checked or false if not.

IsFocussed.title: Is focussed
IsFocussed.description: Returns true if the Java element has keyboard focus. or false if not.

IsExpanded.title: Is expanded
IsExpanded.description: Returns true if the Java element is expanded or false if not.

AdditionalStates_en_US.title: Additional element states en_US
AdditionalStates_en_US.description: Any additional states that the element supports will be listed here in the en_US locale, e.g. multiselectable, transient.

IndexInParent.title: Index in parent
IndexInParent.description: The element index within the current parent element.

ChildrenCount.title: Element child count
ChildrenCount.description: The number of child elements that the element has.

ElementDepth.title: Element depth
ElementDepth.description: The depth of the element from the top-level parent window.

post.description: Returns all Java properties of a Java element. This can be useful if you are uncertain which field holds the property values required.

SearchParentElementJABHandle.title: Parent element JAB handle
SearchParentElementJABHandle.description: The Java element handle which is a parent of the element you are searching for. This could be a window you located earlier using 'Wait for Java desktop element'.

SearchElementJABName.title: Search Java element name
SearchElementJABName.description: The optional Java name of the element to search for. This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchElementJABDescription.title: Search Java element description
SearchElementJABDescription.description: The optional Java element description of the element to search for. This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchElementJABRole.title: Search Java element role
SearchElementJABRole.description: The optional Java element role of the element to search for. This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchSubTree.title: Search child elements
SearchSubTree.description: If set to true then the whole tree below the parent window handle will be searched. This is more thorough but can take longer. If set to false, only elements directly below the parent window handle in the tree will be searched.

MaxRelativeDepth.title: Maximum relative depth
MaxRelativeDepth.description: The maximum relative depth to search from the parent element for child elements. Direct child elements will have a depth value of 0.

MatchIndex.title: Match index
MatchIndex.description: If multiple elements match the search, which element (starting at 1) should be matched. Can be used in conjunction with 'Sort by column' to choose the sort order for matching.

SearchFilter.title: Search filter
SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators and any element field. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Name] like 'Document*' AND [Role] like 'Label*'. See the documentation for more examples.

SortByColumn.title: Sort by column name
SortByColumn.description: If multiple elements match the search, this allows you to specify which element property to sort by. This will be used in conjunction with 'Match index' to pick the required element. For example: If 'Sort by column name' is [TopEdge] and 'Match index' is 1 then the matching element nearest the top of the screen will be matched.

MatchIndexAscending.title: Match index is ascending
MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple elements match the search, should 'Match index' match from the top of the sorted list (true) or from the bottom of the sorted list (false).

CaseSensitiveSearch.title: Case sensitive search
CaseSensitiveSearch.description: Should the element search be case sensitive? When set to True, only elements matching the exact string/text searches will be returned. By default, this is set to false.

OnlySearchVisibleElements.title: Only search visible elements
OnlySearchVisibleElements.description: Should only visible elements be searched? By default, this is set to true.

OnlySearchShowingElements.title: Only search showing elements
OnlySearchShowingElements.description: Should only showing elements be searched? Showing elements are typically items displayed in an alternative tab or collapsed menu. By default, this is set to true.

ElementRolesNotToTraverse.title: Element roles not to traverse
ElementRolesNotToTraverse.description: A comma separated list of roles to not traverse (step into) when searching. The search will still check if the element matches the search criteria however it will not search any child elements. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

MaximumElementsToSearch.title: Maximum elements to search
MaximumElementsToSearch.description: The maximum number of elements to search when looking for the target element, restricting the search to only check the first N number of elements found in the Java tree. By default, this is set to 2000. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

MaximumChildElementsToSearchPerNode.title: Maximum child elements to search per node
MaximumChildElementsToSearchPerNode.description: The maximum number of child elements to search in each element when looking for the target element, restricting the search to only check the first N number of child elements found for each element in the Java tree. By default, this is set to 200. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

MaxStringLength.title: Max string length
MaxStringLength.description: The maximum length of the description field. This can sometimes contain a large amount of text so setting a maximum value can increase search speed. By default, there is no maximum string length so full descriptions will be returned.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

SearchSubTree.description: If set to true then the whole tree below the parent window handle will be searched. This is more thorough but can take longer. If set to false, only elements directly below the parent window handle in the tree will be searched.

MaxRelativeDepth.title: Maximum relative depth
MaxRelativeDepth.description: The maximum relative depth to search from the parent element for child elements. Direct child elements will have a depth value of 0.

MatchIndex.title: Match index
MatchIndex.description: If multiple elements match the search, which element (starting at 1) should be matched. Can be used in conjunction with 'Sort by column' to choose the sort order for matching.

SearchFilter.title: Search filter
SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators and any element field. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Name] like 'Document*' AND [Role] like 'Label*'. See the documentation for more examples.

SortByColumn.title: Sort by column name
SortByColumn.description: If multiple elements match the search, this allows you to specify which element property to sort by. This will be used in conjunction with 'Match index' to pick the required element. For example: If 'Sort by column name' is [TopEdge] and 'Match index' is 1 then the matching element nearest the top of the screen will be matched.

MatchIndexAscending.title: Match index is ascending
MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple elements match the search, should 'Match index' match from the top of the sorted list (true) or from the bottom of the sorted list (false).

CaseSensitiveSearch.title: Case sensitive search
CaseSensitiveSearch.description: Should the element search be case sensitive? When set to True, only elements matching the exact string/text searches will be returned. By default, this is set to false.

OnlySearchVisibleElements.title: Only search visible elements
OnlySearchVisibleElements.description: Should only visible elements be searched? By default, this is set to true.

OnlySearchShowingElements.title: Only search showing elements
OnlySearchShowingElements.description: Should only showing elements be searched? Showing elements are typically items displayed in an alternative tab or collapsed menu. By default, this is set to true.

ElementRolesNotToTraverse.title: Element roles not to traverse
ElementRolesNotToTraverse.description: A comma separated list of roles to not traverse (step into) when searching. The search will still check if the element matches the search criteria however it will not search any child elements. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

MaximumElementsToSearch.title: Maximum elements to search
MaximumElementsToSearch.description: The maximum number of elements to search when looking for the target element, restricting the search to only check the first N number of elements found in the Java tree. By default, this is set to 2000. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

MaximumChildElementsToSearchPerNode.title: Maximum child elements to search per node
MaximumChildElementsToSearchPerNode.description: The maximum number of child elements to search in each element when looking for the target element, restricting the search to only check the first N number of child elements found for each element in the Java tree. By default, this is set to 200. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

post.description: Returns a list of Java application windows and dialogs on the desktop. You must first connect to the Java Access Bridge.

SearchElementLocalizedControlType.title: Search element localized control type
SearchElementLocalizedControlType.description: The optional UIA element localized control type to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchProcessID.title: Search process Id
SearchProcessID.description: The process ID of the running process. This can be retrieved as an output from the "Run Process" action.

FirstItemToReturn.title: First item to return
FirstItemToReturn.description: The element index of the first item to return, starting from 1. If you wish to return the elements in the reverse order (from the bottom of the tree), you can alternatively specify a negative index starting from -1. For example, an index of -10 would return the tenth item from the bottom.

MaxItemsToReturn.title: Max items to return
MaxItemsToReturn.description: The maximum number of elements to return. This parameter can be used to return large sets of elements in smaller chunks, for example large tables. Instead of attempting to return the entire table which may cause a timeout for extremely large tables, you could instead return 500 rows at a time.

SearchChildElements.title: Search child elements
SearchChildElements.description: If set to true then the whole tree below the parent window handle will be searched. This is more thorough but can take longer. If set to false, only elements directly below the parent window handle in the tree will be searched.

MaxStringLength.title: Max string length
MaxStringLength.description: The maximum length of the description field. This can sometimes contain a large amount of text so setting a maximum value can increase search speed. By default, there is no maximum string length so full descriptions will be returned.

IncludeChildProcesses.title: Include child processes
IncludeChildProcesses.description: If set to true and a 'Search process Id' is specified, child processes of that process Id are included in the search. This is common for Java since a launcher EXE often then runs a child 'Java(w).exe' process. If set to false then only a process matching the exact 'Search process Id' will be returned.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

NumberOfElementsFound.title: Number of elements found
NumberOfElementsFound.description: The number of elements found which met the search criteria.

NumberOfElementsReturned.title: Number of elements returned
NumberOfElementsReturned.description: The number of elements returned from the search. This could be lower than the number of elements found if 'Max items to return' was set to a lower number.

JavaDesktopElementsJSON.title: Java desktop elements JSON
JavaDesktopElementsJSON.description: The element properties of the Java desktop elements found that match the search criteria, in JSON format.

ElementDescription.title: Element description
ElementDescription.description: The Java description of the located element (if there is one).

ElementRole.title: Element role
ElementRole.description: The Java role (e.g. frame or panel) of the located element (if there is one).

ElementStates.title: Element states
ElementStates.description: The Java element's supported states (e.g. focusable, visible) in the locale of the Agent session.

ElementStates_en_US.title: Element states en_US
ElementStates_en_US.description: The Java element's supported states (e.g. focusable, visible) in the en_US locale.

ElementLeftEdge.title: Element left edge
ElementLeftEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the left edge of the Java element or window and the left edge of the display.

ElementTopEdge.title: Element top edge
ElementTopEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the top edge of the Java element or window and the top edge of the display.

ElementRightEdge.title: Element right edge
ElementRightEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the right edge of the Java element or window and the left edge of the display.

ElementBottomEdge.title: Element bottom edge
ElementBottomEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the bottom edge of the Java element or window and the top edge of the display.

ElementWidth.title: Element width
ElementWidth.description: The width of the Java element in pixels.

ElementHeight.title: Element height
ElementHeight.description: The height of the Java element in pixels.

IsComponentElement.title: Is component element
IsComponentElement.description: Returns true if the Java element is a container or false if not.

IsActionElement.title: Is action element
IsActionElement.description: Returns true if the Java element is an action element or false if not.

IsSelectionElement.title: Is selection element
IsSelectionElement.description: Returns true if the Java element is a selection or false if not.

IsTextElement.title: Is text element
IsTextElement.description: Returns true if the Java element is a text element or false if not.

IsEnabled.title: Is enabled
IsEnabled.description: Returns true if the Java element is enabled or false if not. A disabled element is typically visible but cannot be interacted with.

IsVisible.title: Is visible
IsVisible.description: Returns true if the Java element is visible or false if not.

IsShowing.title: Is showing
IsShowing.description: Returns true if the Java element is showing or false if not.

IsOpaque.title: Is opaque
IsOpaque.description: Returns true if the Java element is opaque or false if not.

IsFocusable.title: Is focusable
IsFocusable.description: Returns true if the Java element be focussed by the keyboard or false if not. This may be of limited use since most elements are keyboard focusable.

IsEditable.title: Is editable
IsEditable.description: Returns true if the Java element is editable or false if not.

IsSingleLine.title: Is single line
IsSingleLine.description: Returns true if the Java element is a single line or false if not.

IsResizable.title: Is resizable
IsResizable.description: Returns true if the Java element is resizable or false if not.

IsModal.title: Is modal
IsModal.description: Returns true if the Java element is modal or false if not. A modal element will block the main application window, preventing you from interacting with it.

IsCollapsed.title: Is collapsed
IsCollapsed.description: Returns true if the Java element is collapsed or false if not.

IsSelectable.title: Is selectable
IsSelectable.description: Returns true if the Java element is selectable or false if not.

IsSelected.title: Is selected
IsSelected.description: Returns true if the Java element is selected or false if not.

IsVertical.title: Is vertical
IsVertical.description: Returns true if the Java element is vertical or false if not.

IsHorizontal.title: Is horizontal
IsHorizontal.description: Returns true if the Java element is horizontal or false if not.

IsActive.title: Is active
IsActive.description: Returns true if the Java element is active or false if not.

IsChecked.title: Is checked
IsChecked.description: Returns true if the Java element is checked or false if not.

IsFocussed.title: Is focussed
IsFocussed.description: Returns true if the Java element has keyboard focus. or false if not.

IsExpanded.title: Is expanded
IsExpanded.description: Returns true if the Java element is expanded or false if not.

AdditionalStates_en_US.title: Additional element states en_US
AdditionalStates_en_US.description: Any additional states that the element supports will be listed here in the en_US locale, e.g. multiselectable, transient.

IndexInParent.title: Index in parent
IndexInParent.description: The element index within the current parent element.

ChildrenCount.title: Element child count
ChildrenCount.description: The number of child elements that the element has.

ElementDepth.title: Element depth
ElementDepth.description: The depth of the element from the top-level parent window.

post.summary: Get all Java child element properties
post.description: Returns all properties of all Java child elements. This can be useful if you are uncertain which field holds the property values required.

SearchElementJABHandle.title: Search element JAB handle
SearchElementJABHandle.description: The element handle of the element which you want to return the child element properties for. This could be located using 'Get Java element properties' or some other search which returns an element handle.

FirstItemToReturn.title: First item to return
FirstItemToReturn.description: The element index of the first item to return, starting from 1. If you wish to return the elements in the reverse order (from the bottom of the tree), you can alternatively specify a negative index starting from -1. For example, an index of -10 would return the tenth item from the bottom.

MaxItemsToReturn.title: Max items to return
MaxItemsToReturn.description: The maximum number of elements to return. This parameter can be used to return large sets of elements in smaller chunks, for example large tables. Instead of attempting to return the entire table which may cause a timeout for extremely large tables, you could instead return 500 rows at a time.

MaxStringLength.title: Max string length
MaxStringLength.description: The maximum length of the description field. This can sometimes contain a large amount of text so setting a maximum value can increase search speed. By default, there is no maximum string length so full descriptions will be returned.

SearchDescendants.title: Search descendants
SearchDescendants.description: If set to true then all child elements below the parent handle will be searched. This is more thorough but can take longer. If set to false, only direct child elements of the parent handle will be searched.

SearchRole.title: Search Java element role
SearchRole.description: The optional Java element role of the child elements to search for. This can be discovered via Inspection.

MaxRelativeDepth.title: Maximum relative depth
MaxRelativeDepth.description: The maximum relative depth to search from the parent element for child elements. Direct child elements will have a depth value of 0.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

NumberOfChildElementsReturned.title: Number of child elements returned
NumberOfChildElementsReturned.description: The number of child elements returned from the search.

MoreElementsAvailableAtCurrentDepth.title: More elements available at current depth
MoreElementsAvailableAtCurrentDepth.description: Returns true if there are more child elements at the current depth that have not been returned as 'Max items to return' has been set to a lower number.

MoreElementsAvailableAtLowerDepths.title: More elements available at lower depths
MoreElementsAvailableAtLowerDepths.description: Returns true if there are more of child elements available at a lower depth in the Java tree, if 'Max items to return' was set to a lower number.

MoreElementsDeeperThanMaxDepth.title: More elements deeper than max depth
MoreElementsDeeperThanMaxDepth.description: Returns true if there are more child elements available at a lower maximum depth in the Java tree, if 'Maximum relative depth' was set to a lower number.

JavaChildElementsJSON.title: Java child elements JSON
JavaChildElementsJSON.description: A list of all located child elements (and their properties), in JSON format. The properties returned are the same as those returned by the 'Get Java child element properties' action.

post.description: Returns the properties of the parent element of a Java element. This action will only return the properties of the direct parent element and will not search the entire height of the element tree.

SearchElementJABHandle.title: Search element JAB handle
SearchElementJABHandle.description: The element handle of the element which you want to return the parent element properties for. This could be located using 'Get Java element properties' or some other search which returns an element handle.

MaxStringLength.title: Max string length
MaxStringLength.description: The maximum length of the description field. This can sometimes contain a large amount of text so setting a maximum value can increase search speed. By default, there is no maximum string length so full descriptions will be returned.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

ElementJABHandle.title: Element JAB handle
ElementJABHandle.description: If the search element was found, this will hold a numeric element handle which can be used in further actions to act as a 'parent' handle for further searches (i.e. to locate elements relative to this handle).

ElementVMID.title: Element VMID
ElementVMID.description: The ID of the Java virtual machine running the Java program.

ElementName.title: Element name
ElementName.description: The Java name of the located element.

ElementDescription.title: Element description
ElementDescription.description: The Java description of the located element (if there is one).

ElementRole.title: Element role
ElementRole.description: The Java role (e.g. frame or panel) of the located element (if there is one).

ElementStates.title: Element states
ElementStates.description: The Java element's supported states (e.g. focusable, visible) in the locale of the Agent session.

ElementStates_en_US.title: Element states en_US
ElementStates_en_US.description: The Java element's supported states (e.g. focusable, visible) in the en_US locale.

ElementLeftEdge.title: Element left edge
ElementLeftEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the left edge of the Java element or window and the left edge of the display.

ElementTopEdge.title: Element top edge
ElementTopEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the top edge of the Java element or window and the top edge of the display.

ElementRightEdge.title: Element right edge
ElementRightEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the right edge of the Java element or window and the left edge of the display.

ElementBottomEdge.title: Element bottom edge
ElementBottomEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the bottom edge of the Java element or window and the top edge of the display.

ElementWidth.title: Element width
ElementWidth.description: The width of the Java element in pixels.

ElementHeight.title: Element height
ElementHeight.description: The height of the Java element in pixels.

IsComponentElement.title: Is component element
IsComponentElement.description: Returns true if the Java element is a container or false if not.

IsActionElement.title: Is action element
IsActionElement.description: Returns true if the Java element is an action element or false if not.

IsSelectionElement.title: Is selection element
IsSelectionElement.description: Returns true if the Java element is a selection or false if not.

IsTextElement.title: Is text element
IsTextElement.description: Returns true if the Java element is a text element or false if not.

IsEnabled.title: Is enabled
IsEnabled.description: Returns true if the Java element is enabled or false if not. A disabled element is typically visible but cannot be interacted with.

IsVisible.title: Is visible
IsVisible.description: Returns true if the Java element is visible or false if not.

IsShowing.title: Is showing
IsShowing.description: Returns true if the Java element is showing or false if not.

IsOpaque.title: Is opaque
IsOpaque.description: Returns true if the Java element is opaque or false if not.

IsFocusable.title: Is focusable
IsFocusable.description: Returns true if the Java element be focussed by the keyboard or false if not. This may be of limited use since most elements are keyboard focusable.

IsEditable.title: Is editable
IsEditable.description: Returns true if the Java element is editable or false if not.

IsSingleLine.title: Is single line
IsSingleLine.description: Returns true if the Java element is a single line or false if not.

IsResizable.title: Is resizable
IsResizable.description: Returns true if the Java element is resizable or false if not.

IsModal.title: Is modal
IsModal.description: Returns true if the Java element is modal or false if not. A modal element will block the main application window, preventing you from interacting with it.

IsCollapsed.title: Is collapsed

IsSelected.title: Is selected

IsVertical.description: Returns true if the Java element is vertical or false if not.

IsHorizontal.title: Is horizontal
IsHorizontal.description: Returns true if the Java element is horizontal or false if not.

IsActive.description: Returns true if the Java element is active or false if not.

IsFocussed.description: Returns true if the Java element has keyboard focus. or false if not.

IsExpanded.title: Is expanded
IsExpanded.description: Returns true if the Java element is expanded or false if not.

post.description: Presses a Java element (typically a button).

SearchParentElementJABHandle.title: Parent element JAB handle
SearchParentElementJABHandle.description: The Java element handle which is a parent of the element you are searching for. This could be a window you located earlier using 'Wait for Java desktop element'.

SearchElementJABName.title: Search Java element name
SearchElementJABName.description: The optional Java name of the element to search for. This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchElementJABDescription.title: Search Java element description
SearchElementJABDescription.description: The optional Java element description of the element to search for. This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchElementJABRole.title: Search Java element role
SearchElementJABRole.description: The optional Java element role of the element to search for. This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchSubTree.title: Search child elements
SearchSubTree.description: If set to true then the whole tree below the parent window handle will be searched. This is more thorough but can take longer. If set to false, only elements directly below the parent window handle in the tree will be searched.

MaxRelativeDepth.title: Maximum relative depth
MaxRelativeDepth.description: The maximum relative depth to search from the parent element for child elements. Direct child elements will have a depth value of 0.

MatchIndex.title: Match index
MatchIndex.description: If multiple elements match the search, which element (starting at 1) should be matched. Can be used in conjunction with 'Sort by column' to choose the sort order for matching.

SearchFilter.title: Search filter
SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators and any element field. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Name] like 'Document*' AND [Role] like 'Label*'. See the documentation for more examples.

SortByColumn.title: Sort by column name
SortByColumn.description: If multiple elements match the search, this allows you to specify which element property to sort by. This will be used in conjunction with 'Match index' to pick the required element. For example: If 'Sort by column name' is [TopEdge] and 'Match index' is 1 then the matching element nearest the top of the screen will be matched.

MatchIndexAscending.title: Match index is ascending
MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple elements match the search, should 'Match index' match from the top of the sorted list (true) or from the bottom of the sorted list (false).

CaseSensitiveSearch.title: Case sensitive search
CaseSensitiveSearch.description: Should the element search be case sensitive? When set to True, only elements matching the exact string/text searches will be returned. By default, this is set to false.

OnlySearchVisibleElements.title: Only search visible elements
OnlySearchVisibleElements.description: Should only visible elements be searched? By default, this is set to true.

OnlySearchShowingElements.title: Only search showing elements
OnlySearchShowingElements.description: Should only showing elements be searched? Showing elements are typically items displayed in an alternative tab or collapsed menu. By default, this is set to true.

ElementRolesNotToTraverse.title: Element roles not to traverse
ElementRolesNotToTraverse.description: A comma separated list of roles to not traverse (step into) when searching. The search will still check if the element matches the search criteria however it will not search any child elements. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

MaximumElementsToSearch.title: Maximum elements to search
MaximumElementsToSearch.description: The maximum number of elements to search when looking for the target element, restricting the search to only check the first N number of elements found in the Java tree. By default, this is set to 2000. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

MaximumChildElementsToSearchPerNode.title: Maximum child elements to search per node
MaximumChildElementsToSearchPerNode.description: The maximum number of child elements to search in each element when looking for the target element, restricting the search to only check the first N number of child elements found for each element in the Java tree. By default, this is set to 200. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

NumberOfTimesToPressElement.title: Number of times to press element
NumberOfTimesToPressElement.description: The number of times to press the element, by default this is 1.

SecondsToWaitBetweenPresses.title: Seconds to wait between presses
SecondsToWaitBetweenPresses.description: The number of seconds to wait between presses, by default this is 0.05 (20 milliseconds).

AutoDetectActionName.title: Auto detect action name
AutoDetectActionName.description: If set to true (the default) then IA-Connect Agent will attempt to automatically detect the 'click' action name in non-English locales. If there are more than two possible actions for the element then the 'Override action name' will be used. If set to false then IA-Connect Agent will not attempt to detect the 'click' action name in non-English locales and the action may fail unless an 'Override action name' value is provided.

OverrideActionName.title: Override action name
OverrideActionName.description: The name of the 'Click' action in non-English locales, e.g. 'cliquer' or 'hacer clic'. This can be determined from the output of the action 'Get actions for Java element' and is typically case sensitive.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.description: Performs an accessible action for a Java element. These accessible actions for a specific element can be queried by using the 'Get actions for Java element' action. Some common actions are 'click' for a button or 'select-all' for a text element.

SearchSubTree.description: If set to true then the whole tree below the parent window handle will be searched. This is more thorough but can take longer. If set to false, only elements directly below the parent window handle in the tree will be searched.

MaxRelativeDepth.title: Maximum relative depth
MaxRelativeDepth.description: The maximum relative depth to search from the parent element for child elements. Direct child elements will have a depth value of 0.

MatchIndex.title: Match index
MatchIndex.description: If multiple elements match the search, which element (starting at 1) should be matched. Can be used in conjunction with 'Sort by column' to choose the sort order for matching.

SearchFilter.title: Search filter
SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators and any element field. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Name] like 'Document*' AND [Role] like 'Label*'. See the documentation for more examples.

SortByColumn.title: Sort by column name
SortByColumn.description: If multiple elements match the search, this allows you to specify which element property to sort by. This will be used in conjunction with 'Match index' to pick the required element. For example: If 'Sort by column name' is [TopEdge] and 'Match index' is 1 then the matching element nearest the top of the screen will be matched.

MatchIndexAscending.title: Match index is ascending
MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple elements match the search, should 'Match index' match from the top of the sorted list (true) or from the bottom of the sorted list (false).

CaseSensitiveSearch.title: Case sensitive search
CaseSensitiveSearch.description: Should the element search be case sensitive? When set to True, only elements matching the exact string/text searches will be returned. By default, this is set to false.

OnlySearchVisibleElements.title: Only search visible elements
OnlySearchVisibleElements.description: Should only visible elements be searched? By default, this is set to true.

OnlySearchShowingElements.title: Only search showing elements
OnlySearchShowingElements.description: Should only showing elements be searched? Showing elements are typically items displayed in an alternative tab or collapsed menu. By default, this is set to true.

ElementRolesNotToTraverse.title: Element roles not to traverse
ElementRolesNotToTraverse.description: A comma separated list of roles to not traverse (step into) when searching. The search will still check if the element matches the search criteria however it will not search any child elements. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

MaximumElementsToSearch.title: Maximum elements to search
MaximumElementsToSearch.description: The maximum number of elements to search when looking for the target element, restricting the search to only check the first N number of elements found in the Java tree. By default, this is set to 2000. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

MaximumChildElementsToSearchPerNode.title: Maximum child elements to search per node
MaximumChildElementsToSearchPerNode.description: The maximum number of child elements to search in each element when looking for the target element, restricting the search to only check the first N number of child elements found for each element in the Java tree. By default, this is set to 200. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

ClickOffsetX.title: Click offset X
ClickOffsetX.description: The number of X pixels to offset the click action by. This parameter supports both positive (right) and negative (left) offset values.

ClickOffsetY.title: Click offset Y
ClickOffsetY.description: The number of Y pixels to offset the click action by. This parameter supports both positive (down) and negative (up) offset values.

OffsetRelativeTo.title: Offset relative to
OffsetRelativeTo.description: The relative position of the element to offset from (Center / Centre / Middle, Left, Right, Top, Bottom, Top Left, Top Right, Bottom Left, Bottom Right).

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

SearchSubTree.description: If set to true then the whole tree below the parent window handle will be searched. This is more thorough but can take longer. If set to false, only elements directly below the parent window handle in the tree will be searched.

MaxRelativeDepth.title: Maximum relative depth
MaxRelativeDepth.description: The maximum relative depth to search from the parent element for child elements. Direct child elements will have a depth value of 0.

MatchIndex.title: Match index
MatchIndex.description: If multiple elements match the search, which element (starting at 1) should be matched. Can be used in conjunction with 'Sort by column' to choose the sort order for matching.

SearchFilter.title: Search filter
SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators and any element field. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Name] like 'Document*' AND [Role] like 'Label*'. See the documentation for more examples.

SortByColumn.title: Sort by column name
SortByColumn.description: If multiple elements match the search, this allows you to specify which element property to sort by. This will be used in conjunction with 'Match index' to pick the required element. For example: If 'Sort by column name' is [TopEdge] and 'Match index' is 1 then the matching element nearest the top of the screen will be matched.

MatchIndexAscending.title: Match index is ascending
MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple elements match the search, should 'Match index' match from the top of the sorted list (true) or from the bottom of the sorted list (false).

CaseSensitiveSearch.title: Case sensitive search
CaseSensitiveSearch.description: Should the element search be case sensitive? When set to True, only elements matching the exact string/text searches will be returned. By default, this is set to false.

OnlySearchVisibleElements.title: Only search visible elements
OnlySearchVisibleElements.description: Should only visible elements be searched? By default, this is set to true.

OnlySearchShowingElements.title: Only search showing elements
OnlySearchShowingElements.description: Should only showing elements be searched? Showing elements are typically items displayed in an alternative tab or collapsed menu. By default, this is set to true.

ElementRolesNotToTraverse.title: Element roles not to traverse
ElementRolesNotToTraverse.description: A comma separated list of roles to not traverse (step into) when searching. The search will still check if the element matches the search criteria however it will not search any child elements. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

MaximumElementsToSearch.title: Maximum elements to search
MaximumElementsToSearch.description: The maximum number of elements to search when looking for the target element, restricting the search to only check the first N number of elements found in the Java tree. By default, this is set to 2000. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

MaximumChildElementsToSearchPerNode.title: Maximum child elements to search per node
MaximumChildElementsToSearchPerNode.description: The maximum number of child elements to search in each element when looking for the target element, restricting the search to only check the first N number of child elements found for each element in the Java tree. By default, this is set to 200. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

ElementCurrentValue.description: The current value of the element.

ElementMaximumValue.description: The maximum value of the element, if specified.

ElementMinimumValue.description: The minimum value of the element, if specified.

PasswordToInput.title: Password to input

KeyIntervalInMilliseconds.title: Key interval in milliseconds

DoubleClickIntervalInMilliseconds.title: Double click interval in milliseconds

DontInterpretSymbols.title: Dont interpret symbols
DontInterpretSymbols.description: Should symbols in the 'Password to input' not be interpreted as special keys (e.g. + for Shift, ^ for Ctrl)? This should be set to true if you are attempting to input the actual symbols.

post.description: Returns all child selection element items found under the specified Java selection element. You can choose to retrieve the selection element options either by looping through the selection, selecting each individual option in the list OR by reading the labels of the child elements of the selection. If you choose to retrieve the selection element options by reading the labels of the child elements of the selection, you will likely need to expand the selection first by providing the 'Expand first' parameter as 'True' and you can then optionally close the selection afterwards by also providing the 'Collapse after' parameter as 'True'.

GetListOfOptionsBySelecting.title: Get list of options by selecting
GetListOfOptionsBySelecting.description: If set to 'True' then the IA-Connect Agent will attempt to obtain a list of all options in the selection by selecting each one in turn (in JAB). If set to 'False' (the default) then the 'Get list of options by reading labels' parameter should be set to 'True' otherwise the list of options will not be read.

GetListOfOptionsByReadingLabels.title: Get list of options by reading labels
GetListOfOptionsByReadingLabels.description: If set to 'True' then the IA-Connect Agent will attempt to obtain a list of all options in the selection by reading the child labels (in the JAB tree). For drop-down lists you will almost certainly need to set the 'Expand first' parameter to 'True' because the child elements aren't exposed until the list drops down. Also set the 'Collapse after' parameter to 'True' to close the list afterwards. The 'Get list of options by selecting' parameter should also be set to 'False' or this option will be ignored (as you can't get the list via both methods). If set to 'False' (the default) then the 'Get list of options by selecting' parameter should be set to 'True' otherwise the list of options will not be read.

ExpandFirst.title: Expand first
ExpandFirst.description: If set to 'true' then the action will attempt to expand the list before searching for the list item elements. This is useful for dynamic lists as the other list item elements may not be created until the list is expanded. If set to false (the default) then the list will not be expanded.

CollapseAfter.title: Collapse after
CollapseAfter.description: If set to true then the list will be collapsed after executing the search. If set to false (the default) then the list will not be collapsed.

SecondsBetweenExpandCollapse.title: Seconds between expand and collapse
SecondsBetweenExpandCollapse.description: The number of seconds to wait between the expand and collapse actions, if these are set to 'True'. By default, this is 0.05 (20 milliseconds).

MaxListItemsToReturn.title: Max list items to return
MaxListItemsToReturn.description: The maximum number of list items to return, by default this is 100.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

NumberOfSelectedItems.title: Number of selected items
NumberOfSelectedItems.description: The number of child list items found under the parent selection element that are currently selected.

AccessibleSelection1Name.title: Selection 1 name
AccessibleSelection1Name.description: The name of the first selected child list item.

AccessibleSelection1IndexInParent.title: Selection 1 index in list
AccessibleSelection1IndexInParent.description: The index in the list of the first selected child list item.

JABSelectionSelectedItemsJSON.title: Selected items JSON
JABSelectionSelectedItemsJSON.description: The selected child list items of the parent selection element, in JSON format.

JABSelectionListItemsJSON.title: Selection list items JSON
JABSelectionListItemsJSON.description: All child list items of the parent selection element, in JSON format.

post.summary: Select Java list element by index
post.description: Selects the list element that matches the specified index. This is typically used to select an item in a dropdown / menu item.

SearchParentElementJABHandle.title: Parent element JAB handle
SearchParentElementJABHandle.description: The Java element handle which is a parent of the element you are searching for. This could be a window you located earlier using 'Wait for Java desktop element'.

SearchElementJABName.title: Search Java element name
SearchElementJABName.description: The optional Java name of the element to search for. This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchElementJABDescription.title: Search Java element description
SearchElementJABDescription.description: The optional Java element description of the element to search for. This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchElementJABRole.title: Search Java element role
SearchElementJABRole.description: The optional Java element role of the element to search for. This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchSubTree.title: Search child elements
SearchSubTree.description: If set to true then the whole tree below the parent window handle will be searched. This is more thorough but can take longer. If set to false, only elements directly below the parent window handle in the tree will be searched.

MaxRelativeDepth.title: Maximum relative depth
MaxRelativeDepth.description: The maximum relative depth to search from the parent element for child elements. Direct child elements will have a depth value of 0.

MatchIndex.title: Match index
MatchIndex.description: If multiple elements match the search, which element (starting at 1) should be matched. Can be used in conjunction with 'Sort by column' to choose the sort order for matching.

SearchFilter.title: Search filter
SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators and any element field. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Name] like 'Document*' AND [Role] like 'Label*'. See the documentation for more examples.

SortByColumn.title: Sort by column name
SortByColumn.description: If multiple elements match the search, this allows you to specify which element property to sort by. This will be used in conjunction with 'Match index' to pick the required element. For example: If 'Sort by column name' is [TopEdge] and 'Match index' is 1 then the matching element nearest the top of the screen will be matched.

MatchIndexAscending.title: Match index is ascending
MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple elements match the search, should 'Match index' match from the top of the sorted list (true) or from the bottom of the sorted list (false).

CaseSensitiveSearch.title: Case sensitive search
CaseSensitiveSearch.description: Should the element search be case sensitive? When set to True, only elements matching the exact string/text searches will be returned. By default, this is set to false.

OnlySearchVisibleElements.title: Only search visible elements
OnlySearchVisibleElements.description: Should only visible elements be searched? By default, this is set to true.

OnlySearchShowingElements.title: Only search showing elements
OnlySearchShowingElements.description: Should only showing elements be searched? Showing elements are typically items displayed in an alternative tab or collapsed menu. By default, this is set to true.

ElementRolesNotToTraverse.title: Element roles not to traverse
ElementRolesNotToTraverse.description: A comma separated list of roles to not traverse (step into) when searching. The search will still check if the element matches the search criteria however it will not search any child elements. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

MaximumElementsToSearch.title: Maximum elements to search
MaximumElementsToSearch.description: The maximum number of elements to search when looking for the target element, restricting the search to only check the first N number of elements found in the Java tree. By default, this is set to 2000. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

MaximumChildElementsToSearchPerNode.title: Maximum child elements to search per node
MaximumChildElementsToSearchPerNode.description: The maximum number of child elements to search in each element when looking for the target element, restricting the search to only check the first N number of child elements found for each element in the Java tree. By default, this is set to 200. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

ItemIndex.title: Item index
ItemIndex.description: The index (starting at 1) of the list item to select or deselect.

SelectItem.title: Select item
SelectItem.description: If set to 'True' (the default) then the item will be selected. If set to 'False' then the item will be deselected. This is typically only used with a multi-select.

ClearSelectionFirst.title: Clear selection first
ClearSelectionFirst.description: If set to 'True' (the default) then the selection will be cleared first. This is mainly used for multi-selects because you need to choose if you are selecting additional items or selecting only a single item (by clearing first). If set to 'False' then the selection will not be cleared first.

RecoverOnFailure.title: Recover on failure
RecoverOnFailure.description: If set to 'True' then the originally selected list items will be recovered if the new selection fails. For example, if item 3 was selected and you try selecting item 90 (which doesn't exist) then item 3 will be re-selected. If set to 'False' then the originally selected list items will not be recovered.

Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

If set to 'False' (the default) then the 'Get list of options by reading labels' parameter should be set to 'True' otherwise the list of options will not be read.

GetListOfOptionsByReadingLabels.title: Get list of options by reading labels
GetListOfOptionsByReadingLabels.description: If set to 'True' (the default) then the IA-Connect Agent will attempt to obtain a list of all options in the selection by reading the child labels (in the JAB tree). For drop-down lists you will almost certainly need to set the 'Expand first' parameter to 'True' because the child elements aren't exposed until the list drops down. Also set the 'Collapse after' parameter to 'True' to close the list afterwards. ForceEvenIfInCorrectState.title: Force even if in correct state
ForceEvenIfInCorrectState.description: If set to 'True' then the element will be selected even if it is already selected. If set to 'False' (the default) then the IA-Connect Agent will do nothing if the list element is already selected.

RecoverOnFailure.title: Recover on failure

For example, if item 3 was selected and you try selecting item 90 (which doesn't exist) then item 3 will be re-selected. If set to 'False' then the originally selected list items will not be recovered.

SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators and any element field. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Name] like 'Document*' AND [Role] like 'Label*'. See the documentation for more examples.

SortByColumn.title: Sort by column name
SortByColumn.description: If multiple elements match the search, this allows you to specify which element property to sort by. This will be used in conjunction with 'Match index' to pick the required element. For example: If 'Sort by column name' is [TopEdge] and 'Match index' is 1 then the matching element nearest the top of the screen will be matched.

MatchIndexAscending.title: Match index is ascending
MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple elements match the search, should 'Match index' match from the top of the sorted list (true) or from the bottom of the sorted list (false).

CaseSensitiveSearch.title: Case sensitive search
CaseSensitiveSearch.description: Should the element search be case sensitive? When set to True, only elements matching the exact string/text searches will be returned. By default, this is set to false.

OnlySearchVisibleElements.title: Only search visible elements
OnlySearchVisibleElements.description: Should only visible elements be searched? By default, this is set to true.

OnlySearchShowingElements.title: Only search showing elements
OnlySearchShowingElements.description: Should only showing elements be searched? Showing elements are typically items displayed in an alternative tab or collapsed menu. By default, this is set to true.

ElementRolesNotToTraverse.title: Element roles not to traverse
ElementRolesNotToTraverse.description: A comma separated list of roles to not traverse (step into) when searching. The search will still check if the element matches the search criteria however it will not search any child elements. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

MaximumElementsToSearch.title: Maximum elements to search
MaximumElementsToSearch.description: The maximum number of elements to search when looking for the target element, restricting the search to only check the first N number of elements found in the Java tree. By default, this is set to 2000. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

MaximumChildElementsToSearchPerNode.title: Maximum child elements to search per node
MaximumChildElementsToSearchPerNode.description: The maximum number of child elements to search in each element when looking for the target element, restricting the search to only check the first N number of child elements found for each element in the Java tree. By default, this is set to 200. This parameter can be used to optimise element searching. This is only used if the 'Search child elements' input parameter is set to 'True'.

EnumerateViewport.title: Enumerate viewport
EnumerateViewport.description: The viewport element typically contains the table and represents the visible area of the table. If set to 'True' (the default) then IA-Connect Agent will attempt to detect the table visible bounds and the index of the cells at each corner by calculating the size of the viewport. This allows you to determine which components of the table are currently visible on screen. If set to 'False' then the viewport coordinates will not be populated.

ProcessViewportParents.title: Process viewport parents
ProcessViewportParents.description: If set to 'True' (the default) then the parent elements of the viewport will also be processed to help refine the visible size of the viewport. This is useful if it is embedded in another viewport. If set to 'False' then viewport parent elements will not be processed.

MaxViewportParentsToProcess.title: Max viewport parents to process
MaxViewportParentsToProcess.description: The maximum number of parent elements to process when enumerating the viewport. By default, this is set to 50.

ViewportParentElementRolesToConsider.title: Viewport parent element roles to consider
ViewportParentElementRolesToConsider.description: The roles of the viewport parent element to consider when enumerating to calculate the viewport size. This is used to exclude parent elements that are smaller in size than the viewport which can skew the size calculation, for example page tabs. By default, these are: Panel, Viewport, Layered pane, Root pane.

ViewportLeftMargin.title: Viewport left margin
ViewportLeftMargin.description: A left inner margin for the enumerated viewport. This value can be used to exclude any cells which might be only showing by a single pixel or two and are almost entirely offscreen. By default, this is set to 2 and should only be increased if you are trying to influence the data returned by the IA-Connect Agent.

ViewportTopMargin.title: Viewport top margin
ViewportTopMargin.description: A top inner margin for the enumerated viewport. This value can be used to exclude any cells which might be only showing by a single pixel or two and are almost entirely offscreen. By default, this is set to 2 and should only be increased if you are trying to influence the data returned by the IA-Connect Agent.

ViewportRightMargin.title: Viewport right margin
ViewportRightMargin.description: A right inner margin for the enumerated viewport. This value can be used to exclude any cells which might be only showing by a single pixel or two and are almost entirely offscreen. By default, this is set to 2 and should only be increased if you are trying to influence the data returned by the IA-Connect Agent.

ViewportBottomMargin.title: Viewport bottom margin
ViewportBottomMargin.description: A bottom inner margin for the enumerated viewport. This value can be used to exclude any cells which might be only showing by a single pixel or two and are almost entirely offscreen. By default, this is set to 2 and should only be increased if you are trying to influence the data returned by the IA-Connect Agent.

post.description: Returns the properties and contents of a specified cell within a Java table element. This is an element with rows, columns, a header and cells (i.e. a table). You can optionally specify whether to determine which if the cell is currently visible on screen and it's coordinates by enumerating the viewport.  The viewport element typically contains the table (e.g. it is a parent element of the table) and represents the visible area of the table.

SearchElementJABName.title: Search Java element name

MaxRelativeDepth.description: The maximum relative depth to search from the parent element for child elements. Direct child elements will have a depth value of 0.

CellIndex.title: Cell index
CellIndex.description: The cell index in the table. The first cell in the first row will have an index of 1, increasing by 1 for each cell in the row. Therefore, in a table with 5 rows and 3 columns, the first cell in the second row will have an index of 4.

RowExtent.title: Cell row extent
RowExtent.description: The number of rows that the cell spans. This will commonly be 1 unless the cell is merged across multiple rows.

ColumnExtent.title: Cell column extent
ColumnExtent.description: The number of columns that the cell spans. This will commonly be 1 unless the cell is merged across multiple columns.

IsSelected.title: Cell is selected
IsSelected.description: Returns true the cell is currently selected or false if not.

CellLeftEdge.title: Cell left edge
CellLeftEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the left edge of the cell element and the left edge of the display.

CellTopEdge.title: Cell top edge
CellTopEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the top edge of the cell element and the top edge of the display.

CellRightEdge.title: Cell right edge
CellRightEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the right edge of the cell element and the left edge of the display.

CellBottomEdge.title: Cell bottom edge
CellBottomEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the bottom edge of the cell element and the top edge of the display.

CellWidth.title: Cell width
CellWidth.description: The width of the cell element in pixels.

CellHeight.title: Cell height
CellHeight.description: The height of the cell element in pixels.

CellOnscreen.title: Cell is visible onscreen
CellOnscreen.description: Returns true if the cell is visible onscreen, or false if not.

CellVisibleResultIsCertain.title: Visible result is certain
CellVisibleResultIsCertain.description: Returns true if the 'Cell is visible onscreen' result is certain. This will be set to 'False' if any one of the 4 parent table bounds could not be calculated.

CellJABHandle.title: Cell JAB handle
CellJABHandle.description: The element handle to the table cell.

FirstColumnToReturn.title: First column to return

MaxColumnsToReturn.title: Max columns to return
MaxColumnsToReturn.description: The maximum number of columns to return. By default, all columns are returned.

UseColumnHeadersFromTable.title: Use column headers from table
UseColumnHeadersFromTable.description: If set to 'True' then the IA-Connect Agent will attempt to return the output collection columns to match the column names in the Java table. If set to 'False' (the default) then the column headers will be called 'Column_N' in the collection (since collections cannot have blank names).

ReturnRowIndexInOutputCollection.title: Return row index in output collection
ReturnRowIndexInOutputCollection.description: If set to 'True' (the default) then the IA-Connect Agent will return the row index in the output collection as an additional column. By default, the row index column will be called '_Row_index_' however this can be changed by passing a column name in the 'Name of column to store row index' parameter. This is useful if you plan to filter the output collection and keep track of which row the filtered result relates to. If set to 'False' then no row index column will be returned.

NameOfColumnToStoreRowIndex.title: Name of column to store row index
NameOfColumnToStoreRowIndex.description: If 'Return row index in output collection' is set to 'True' then you can override the default column name of '_Row_Index' by providing a value here.

NumberOfColumnsInTable.title: Number of columns in table

NumberOfSelectedRows.title: Number of selected rows

NumberOfSelectedColumns.title: Number of selected columns
NumberOfSelectedColumns.description: The number of columns that are currently selected.

NumberOfRowsReturned.title: Number of rows returned
NumberOfRowsReturned.description: The number of rows returned, which could be lower than the number of rows found if 'Max rows to return' was set to a lower number.

NumberOfColumnsReturned.title: Number of columns returned
NumberOfColumnsReturned.description: The number of columns returned, which could be lower than the number of columns found if 'Max columns to return' was set to a lower number.

TableContentsJSON.title: Table contents JSON
TableContentsJSON.description: The contents of the table element, in JSON format. The column names of this collection will match the column names of the table element if the 'Use column headers from table' was set to true. If the column name is blank, it will be called 'Column_N' in the collection (since collections cannot have blank names). If the column name is a duplicate, it will have '_N' appended to the name (since collections cannot have duplicate column names).
